channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: After California's vote to counter Trump, here's where redistricting stands
item.description: In the summer, Texas drew new lines to help the GOP win in the midterm elections. California countered this week. The Republicans might have an edge i...

item.title: Supreme Court allows Trump to prohibit gender election on passports
item.description: The court's decision is not a final ruling, however; it just permits Trump's passport policy to go into effect while litigation continues in the lower...

item.title: White House strikes deals for lower prices on obesity drugs
item.description: Medicare beneficiaries will soon be able to get obesity and Type 2 diabetes drugs for a $50 copay. But there are some limitations.

item.title: Subway sandwich thrower found not guilty in D.C. jury rebuke
item.description: The acquittal on a misdemeanor charge comes after the case came to represent broader resistance in the nation's capital to the Trump administration's ...

item.title: 50 years ago, the Edmund Fitzgerald, a 'rock star' ship, sank in Lake Superior
item.description: Twenty-nine sailors drowned when the Edmund Fitzgerald went down in the Great Lakes' icy waters on Nov. 10, 1975. The ship was immortalized in a surpr...

item.title: UPS plane crashes near Louisville airport, killing 12; black boxes found
item.description: The number of fatalities may increase after a UPS plane crashed Tuesday near the Louisville International Airport in Kentucky, Gov. Andy Beshear said.

item.title: Judge orders Trump administration to fully fund SNAP benefits for November
item.description: U.S. District Judge John McConnell ordered the Trump administration to provide the full food stamp benefits by Friday.

item.title: Federal judge orders Trump administration to fully fund SNAP benefits in November
item.description: A federal judge in Rhode Island has ordered the Trump administration to find the money to fully fund SNAP benefits for November.

item.title: Damon Jones pleads not guilty in alleged gambling scheme cases
item.description: Former NBA player and coach Damon Jones entered not guilty pleas Thursday in a pair of cases alleging his involvement in illegal gambling rings.

item.title: Busiest US airports face flight reductions because of government shutdown
item.description: Flight capacity will be cut at major airports as air traffic controllers report issues with fatigue amid staff shortages.

item.title: Nancy Pelosi announces retirement after decades in US Congress
item.description: Pelosi made history as the first female Speaker and left an indelible mark on US politics.

item.title: Senate talks continue over ending shutdown as Democrats weigh offer
item.description: Senators continued talks over resolving the government shutdown, with Republicans saying they are waiting to hear from Democrats. Follow live updates ...

item.title: Russian soldier sentenced to life in jail in unprecedented Ukrainian trial
item.description: In the first ruling of its kind, Dmitry Kurashov was found guilty of killing an unarmed Ukrainian soldier who had surrendered.

item.title: COP30: World leaders take aim at Trump for climate inaction
item.description: World leaders address COP30 climate summit in Belém and take aim at Trump record on climate change.

item.title: A former teacher shot by student, 6, wins $10M jury verdict against ex-assistant principal
Greek coastguard chief to be prosecuted over deadly migrant shipwreck
item.description: Vice Adm Tryfon Kontizas is one of four senior coastguard figures to face manslaughter charges over the 2023 disaster.

item.title: Chicago judge says Border Patrol official lied about threats before restricting agents’ use force
Attorneys for Jan. 6 defendants face lawsuits for plagiarism
item.description: A Texas-based researcher produced a 26-page study for a defense lawyer in a Jan. 6 Oathkeepers case to argue for a change of venue, which she alleges ...
